abstract: The deal to buy Tellme Networks was said to be worth more than $800 million, making it Microsoft’s biggest acquisition since 2002.
snippet: The deal to buy Tellme Networks was said to be worth more than $800 million, making it Microsoft’s biggest acquisition since 2002.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft said yesterday that it had agreed to buy Tellme Networks to add voice-recognition software that lets users obtain a phone listing, order a pizza and search the Internet.

headline.main: Microsoft Agrees to Buy Maker of Voice-Recognition Software
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Agrees to Buy Maker Of Voice-Recognition Software
